oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Provost pass for Samuel Bogart of Monroe County, Tennessee
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Samuel Bogart lived in Monroe County and had served in Co. G, 37th Tenn. Inf. Regt., CSA. He took the oath of allegiance to the Union on September 17, 1863 in Athens, Tennessee and probably returned home. Picket passes were necessary to travel in many areas in Tennessee during the war in an attempt to curtail guerilla warfare. This is a picket pass good for one day.
